item.title: Current Courses
item.description: Spring 2023 Math 247: Linear Algebra I We will explore the algebra of matrices, determinants, systems of linear equations, vector spaces, linear transformations, and characteristic value problems. Prerequisites: MATH 122 with C or better or consent. Math 280: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science This course is an introduction to mathematical concepts central to theoretical computer science, including sets, relations and functions, propositional logic, proof techniques, recurrence relations, graphs and trees, and discrete probability.

item.title: Research
item.description: Improving Online Rent-or-Buy Algorithms with Sequential Decision Making and ML Predictions Link In this work we study online rent-or-buy problems as a sequential decision making problem. We show how one can integrate predictions, typically coming from a machine learning (ML) setup, into this framework. Specifically, we consider the ski-rental problem and the dynamic TCP acknowledgment problem. We present new online algorithms and obtain explicit performance bounds in-terms of the accuracy of the prediction.

item.title: About this Website
